text: Jimmy Monaghan (Irish: Seamus Ó Muíneacháin) is an Irish musician from Belmullet, Ireland. He is the lead singer, guitarist, and songwriter for the anti-folk band Music for Dead Birds. He has also released music under various monikers including The Crytearionshttp://www.swnk.org/reviews/the-crytearions- i-see-what-it-is-and-i-am-scared/ and Christian Bookshop.https://www.hotpress.com/music/christian-bookshop-9232933 ==Early life== He was born in Danbury, Connecticut, and moved to Ireland as a child. As a teenager he was an amateur boxer, winning four Irish national titles.http://www.geesalaboxingclub.com/membersformer-members.html He won a silver medal at the 2004 Four Nations tournament boxing for Ireland and received the Western People Sports Star of the year award the same year.http://www.mayopics.com/sport/WesternPeopleAwards/2004/glry/index/mu6h0060__monaghans_tn.html During his time representing Ireland internationally he fought against the German amateur boxer Gottlieb Weiss.http://amateur- boxing.strefa.pl/DualsLeague/2003/DualIRL_BEL-GER.html ==Music== Monaghan has stated that his early musical influences were Irish traditional music and nu- metal.https://nomoreworkhorse.com/2017/08/06/interview-with-seamus- omuineachain/ His first album with Music for Dead Birds, And then it rained for seven days, was released in 2009 by the Irish record label Rusted Rail.http://www.ondarock.it/recensioni/2009_deadbirds.htm In July 2012 Psychonavigation Records released an album of his instrumental piano recordings under his Irish name Seamus O'Muineachain. The Irish Times reviewed the album positively, calling it "a tremulous if tranquil success." Bleep.com said of the album "He reveals ten tracks of delicately crafted classicism, a unique piano soundtrack indebted with heart-wrenching cinematic emotion." To promote the album he performed at The Electric Picnic festival in September, 2012. The song Shadowboxing from the album was put into rotation on the Australian Broadcasting Corporation and the song I Am Always in Your Power was used in the Emmy Award nominated series Beat Girl.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w_RoBGpNGfshttp://www.independent.ie/irish- news/beat-girl-nominated-for-emmy-award-29631762.html Throughout 2012 he played drums for the Galway based folk band Yawning Chasm.https://www.advertiser.ie/mullingar/article/55130/top-folk-acts-set-for- passionfruit-theatrehttp://www.thegmanworld.com/2012/08/the-g-man-interview-w- yawning-chasm.html In 2013 he released the lo-fi punk album I See What It Is And I Am Scared under the pseudonym 'The Crytearions'.http://www.swnk.org/reviews/the-crytearions-i-see-what-it-is-and- i-am-scared/ The album found a following on-line from internet radio stations such as Dandelion Radiohttp://www.dandelionradio.com/artist/The+Crytearions and music blogs including Tiny Mix Tapes.http://www.tinymixtapes.com/mixtape/angry-at-potatoes-confused One review posted by thumped.ie called the album "Uncompromising, entirely unpolished and, in places, not entirely pleasant".https://thumped.com/music/music-reviews/the-crytearions-i-see-what- it-is-and-i-am-scared/ In 2017 he produced and released the instrumental Cloves, the second album to be released under his Irish name Seamus O'Muineachain. The track Forest Frost was released to radio and broadcast by RTÉ Raidió na Gaeltachta.http://www.rte.ie/rnag/an-taobh- tuathail/programmes/2017/0724/891864-an-taobh-tuathail- monday-24-july-2017/?clipid=2545267 Shortly after its release, the album was The Irish Times New Release of The Weekhttps://www.irishtimes.com/culture/music/the-10-best-new-irish-tracks-of- the-week-1.3182352 and was later featured on Star's End 2017 end of year list.http://www.starsend.org/17rev.html In 2019 he released the album City of Lakes while living in Hanoi, Vietnam.https://nomoreworkhorse.com/2019/06/28/seamus-omuineachain-city-of- lakes-album-review/ The lead track Impossible to Know was broadcast on RTÉ Raidió na Gaeltachtahttps://www.rte.ie/rnag/an-taobh- tuathail/programmes/2019/0701/1058885-an-taobh-tuathail- monday-1-july-2019/?clipid=103145186 and RTÉ Radio 1,https://www.rte.ie/radio1/playback/programmes/2019/0615/1055428-playback- saturday-15-june-2019/ while the track 'Ghosts' was included on Star's End 2019 year in review show.http://www.starsend.org/playlists/01.12.20.html In March 2020, KEXP and KDHX premiered tracks from his fourth solo album Blue Moon Set.http://www.kexplorer.com/artist/220394https://spinitron.com/KDHX/pl/10480506/Synthetic- Sounds The album received a positive review in Rockerilla magazine https://issuu.com/rockerilla/docs/476 and was featured on BBC Radio 6 Music.https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m000hmlf Several music videos were created for the album, including a video for 'Slow Closing Day' by Irish experimental film-maker Maximilian Le Cain.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Km7CYGJrTKI ==Dramatic Work== His first stage play, Knock, knock, was performed in February 2011 by the Erris Performing Arts Group in his home town of Belmullet, Co Mayo.http://www.mayococo.ie/en/Services/ArtsOffice/ArtsUpdate- Newsletters/2011/January2011/Articles/Article,15250,en.aspx Later that year his radio drama Thumb was shortlisted for the RTÉ PJ O'Connor Award.https://web.archive.org/web/20120523195335/http://www.rte.ie/radio1/pjoconnorawards/pjoconnor2011.html In 2015 he appeared in a Maltese stage production of Butterflies Are Free which ran at Saint James Cavalier in Valletta.http://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2015-05-11/stage/Butterflies- Are-Free-6736135340 ==Personal life== In 2016 an image of him cycling on the Aran Islands was used on an Irish post stamp.http://www.theirishworld.com/wild-atlantic-way-new-stamps/ ==Discography== With Music for Dead Birds Albums * And then it rained for seven days, 2009, Rusted Rail * The Pope's Sister, 2011 * Vitamins, 2014 * Pagan Blessings, 2018 EPs * Black Tides Falling, 2010 https://www.advertiser.ie/Galway/article/28894/music-for-dead-birds-release- new-ep * Your Brand New Life, 2015 https://www.advertiser.ie/galway/article/80035/music-for-dead-birds-to-open- october-citg-gigs * Nail & Tooth EP, 2017 https://thethinair.net/2017/08/ep- stream-music-for-dead-birds-nail-tooth/ As Seamus O'Muineachain * Seamus O'Muineachain, 2012 * Cloves, 2017https://nomoreworkhorse.com/2017/07/17/seamus-omuineachain-cloves-album- review/ * City of Lakes, 2019 * Blue Moon Set, 2020 As The Crytearions Albums * The Crytearions, 2013, Dramacore http://www.dramacore.com/info/136.htm * I See What It Is And I Am Scared, 2013https://thefirenote.com/2013/11/05/the- crytearions-i-see-what-it-is-and-i-am-scared-album-review/ * These Songs Hate You, 2015 Compilations *The Crytearions: Selected Recordings from the Album Trilogy, 2016 http://thethinair.net/2016/02/download-the-crytearions-selected- recordings-from-the-album-trilogy/https://www.faetonmusic.com/2016/04/the- crytearions-selected-recordings-from-the-album-trilogy-2016/ Other * Christian Bookshop, Owl & Hat Records, 2012 * Winston Seedlark - Spain, Ghost Home Recordings, 2016 https://winstonseedlark.bandcamp.com/album/spain ==References== Category:1988 births Category:Living people Category:Musicians from County Mayo Category:Irish male singers Category:American male title: Jimmy Monaghan
